summary.long: Numbers is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The Lord spake again unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, in the first day of the second month, in the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take ye the sum of all the Congregation of the children of Israel, after their families and households of their fathers, with the number of their names: to wit, all the males, man by man:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From twenty years old and above, all that go forth to the war in Israel: thou and Aaron shall number them throughout their armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with you shall be men of every tribe, such as are the heads of the house of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the men that shall stand with you, of the tribe of Reuben, Elizur, the son of Shedeur:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Zebulun, Eliab, the son of Helon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the children of Joseph: of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud: of Manasseh, Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Dan, Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Asher, Pagiel, the son of Ocran:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were famous in the Congregation, princes of the tribes of their fathers, and heads over thousands in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron took these men which are expressed by their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called all the Congregation together in the first day of the second month, who declared their kindred by their families, and by the houses of their fathers according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, man by man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord had commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So were the sons of Reuben Israelâ€™s eldest son by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers according to the number of their names, man by man, every male from twenty years old and above, as many as went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them, I say, of the tribe of Reuben, was six and forty thousand, and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Simeon by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, the sum thereof by the number of their names, man by man, every male from twenty years old, and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sum of them, I say, of the tribe of Simeon was nine and fifty thousand and three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Gad by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them, I say, of the tribe of Gad was five and forty thousand, and six hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Judah by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them, I say, of the tribe of Judah, was three score and fourteen thousand, and six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Issachar by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Issachar was four and fifty thousand, and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Zebulun by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above: all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Zebulun was seven and fifty thousand and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Joseph, namely of the sons of Ephraim by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Ephraim was forty thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Manasseh by their generations, by their families and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Manasseh was two and thirty thousand and two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Benjamin by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Benjamin was five and thirty thousand and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Dan by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Dan was three score and two thousand, and seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Asher by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went forth to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Asher was one and forty thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the children of Naphtali, by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and above, all that went to the war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of them also of the tribe of Naphtali was three and fifty thousand, and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sums which Moses, and Aaron numbered, and the Princes of Israel, the twelve men which were every one for the house of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this was all the sum of the sons of Israel, by the houses of their fathers, from twenty years old and above, all that went to the war in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all they were in number six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites, after the tribes of their fathers were not numbered among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had spoken unto Moses, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only thou shalt not number the tribe of Levi, neither take the sum of them among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou shalt appoint the Levites over the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and over all the instruments thereof, and over all things that belong to it: they shall bear the Tabernacle, and all the instruments thereof, and shall minister in it, and shall dwell round about the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Tabernacle goeth forth, the Levites shall take it down: and when the Tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up: for the stranger that cometh near, shall be slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the children of Israel shall pitch their tents every man in his camp, and every man under his standard throughout their armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall pitch round about the Tabernacle of the Testimony, lest vengeance come upon the Congregation of the children of Israel, and the Levites shall take the charge of the Tabernacle of the Testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses: so did they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man of the children of Israel shall camp by his standard, and under the ensign of their fatherâ€™s house: far off, about the Tabernacle of the Congregation shall they pitch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the East side toward the rising of the sun, shall they of the standard of the host of Judah pitch according to their armies: and Nahshon the son of Amminadab shall be captain of the sons of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were seventy and four thousand and six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next unto him shall they of the tribe of Issachar pitch, and Nethanel the son of Zuar shall be the captain of the sons of Issachar:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number thereof were four and fifty thousand, and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribe of Zebulun, and Eliab the son of Helon captain over the sons of Zebulun:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number thereof seven and fifty thousand and four hundred:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole number of the host of Judah are an hundred fourscore and six thousand, and four hundred according to their armies: they shall first set forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the South side shall be the standard of the host of Reuben according to their armies: and the captain over the sons of Reuben shall be Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number thereof, six and forty thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by him shall the tribe of Simeon pitch, and the captain over the sons of Simeon shall be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host, and the number of them, nine and fifty thousand and three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tribe of Gad, and the captain over the sons of Gad shall be Eliasaph the son of Deuel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were five and forty thousand, six hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the number of the camp of Reuben were an hundred and one and fifty thousand, and four hundred and fifty according to their armies, and they shall set forth in the second place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Tabernacle of the Congregation shall go with the host of the Levites, in the midst of the camp as they have pitched, so shall they go forward, every man in his order, according to their standards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The standard of the camp of Ephraim shall be toward the West according to their armies: and the captain over the sons of Ephraim shall be Elishama the son of Ammihud:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were forty thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by him shall be the tribe of Manasseh and the captain over the sons of Manasseh, shall be Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were two and thirty thousand and two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tribe of Benjamin, and the captain over the sons of Benjamin shall be Abidan, the son of Gideoni:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host, and the number of them were five and thirty thousand and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the number of the camp of Ephraim were an hundred and eight thousand and one hundred according to their armies, and they shall go in the third place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The standard of the host of Dan shall be toward the North according to their armies: and the captain over the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were two and threescore thousand and seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by him shall the tribe of Asher pitch, and the captain over the sons of Asher shall be Pagiel the son of Ocran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were one and forty thousand, and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribe of Naphtali, and the captain over the children of Naphtali shall be Ahira the son of Enan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his host and the number of them were three and fifty thousand and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the number of the host of Dan was an hundred and seven and fifty thousand and six hundred: they shall go hindmost with their standards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sums of the children of Israel by the houses of their fathers, all the number of the host, according to their armies, six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses: so they pitched according to their standards, and so they journeyed every one with his families, according to the houses of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also were the generations of Aaron and Moses, in the day that the Lord spake with Moses in mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these are the names of the sons of Aaron, Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron the anointed Priests, whom Moses did consecrate to minister in the Priestâ€™s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord, when they offered strange fire before the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai, and had no children: but Eleazar and Ithamar served in the Priestâ€™s office in the sight of Aaron their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the tribe of Levi, and set them before Aaron the Priest that they may serve him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And take the charge with him, even the charge of the whole Congregation, before the Tabernacle of the Congregation to do the service of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall also keep all the instruments of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and have the charge of the children of Israel to do the service of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt give the Levites unto Aaron and to his sons: for they are given him freely from among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt appoint Aaron and his sons to execute their Priestâ€™s office: and the stranger that cometh near, shall be slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have even taken the Levites from among the children of Israel: for all the firstborn that openeth the matrice among the children of Israel, and the Levites shall be mine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because all the firstborn are mine: for the same day, that I smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified unto me all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast: mine they shall be: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Number the children of Levi after the houses of their fathers, in their families: every male from a month old and above shalt thou number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses numbered them according to the word of the Lord, as he was commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these were the sons of Levi by their names, Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also these were the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons also of Kohath by their families: Amram and Izehar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of Levi, according to the houses of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Gershon came the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimites: these are the families of the Gershonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sum whereof (after the number of all the males from a month old and above) was counted seven thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the Gershonites shall pitch behind the Tabernacle Westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain and ancient of the house of the Gershonites shall be Eliasaph the son of Lael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the charge of the sons of Gershon in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, shall be the Tabernacle, and the pavilion, the covering thereof, and the veil of the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hanging of the court, and the veil of the door of the court which is near the Tabernacle, and near the Altar round about, and the cords of it for all the service thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Kohath came the family of the Amramites, and the family of the Izharites, and the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites: these are the families of the Kohathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of all the males from a month old and above, was eight thousand and six hundred, having the charge of the Sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the sons of Kohath shall pitch on the South side of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain and ancient of the house and families of the Kohathites shall be Elizaphan the son of Uzziel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their charge shall be the Ark, and the Table, and the Candlestick, and the altars, and the instruments of the Sanctuary that they minister with, and the veil, and all that serveth thereto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar the son of Aaron the Priest shall be chief captain of the Levites, having the oversight of them that have the charge of the Sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Merari came the family of the Mahlites, and the family of the Mushites: these are the families of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sum of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and above was six thousand and two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain and the ancient of the house of the families of Merari shall be Zuriel the son of Abihail: they shall pitch on the Northside of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the charge and custody of the sons of Merari shall be the boards of the Tabernacle, and the bars thereof, and his pillars, and his sockets, and all the instruments thereof, and all that serveth thereto,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the pillars of the court round about, with their sockets, and their pins and their cords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also on the forefront of the Tabernacle toward the East, before the Tabernacle I say, of the Congregation Eastward shall Moses and Aaron and his sons pitch, having the charge of the Sanctuary, and the charge of the children of Israel: but the stranger that cometh near shall be slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole sum of the Levites, which Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of the Lord throughout their families, even all the males from a month old and above, was two and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Number all the firstborn that are males among the children of Israel from a month old and above, and take the number of their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the Levites to me for all the firstborn of the children of Israel (I am the Lord) and the cattle of the Levites for all the firstborn of the cattle of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses numbered, as the Lord commanded him, all the firstborn of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the firstborn males rehearsed by name (from a month old and above) according to their number were two and twenty thousand, two hundred seventy and three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the Levites for all the firstborn of the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites for their cattle, and the Levites shall be mine, (I am the Lord.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the redeeming of the two hundred seventy and three, (which are more than the Levites) of the firstborn of the children of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also take five shekels for every person: after the weight of the Sanctuary shalt thou take it: the shekel containeth twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt give the money, wherewith the odd number of them is redeemed, unto Aaron and to his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Moses took the redemption of them that were redeemed, being more than the Levites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the firstborn of the children of Israel took he the money: even a thousand three hundred three score and five shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the money of them that were redeemed, unto Aaron and to his sons according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the sum of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, after their families, and houses of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and above, even until fifty years old all that enter into the assembly to do the work in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be the office of the sons of Kohath in the Tabernacle of the Congregation about the holiest of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the host removeth, then Aaron and his sons shall come and take down the covering veil, and shall cover the Ark of the Testimony therewith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall put thereon a covering of badgerâ€™s skins, and shall spread upon it a cloth altogether of blue silk, and put to the bars thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon the table of show bread, they shall spread a cloth of blue silk, and put thereon the dishes, and the incense cups and goblets, and coverings to cover it with, and the bread shall be thereon continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall spread upon them a covering of scarlet, and cover the same with a covering of badgerâ€™s skins, and put to the bars thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall take a cloth of blue silk, and cover the candlestick of light with his lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, and all the oil vessels thereof, which they occupy about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall put it, and all the instruments thereof in a covering of badgerâ€™s skins, and put it upon the bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also upon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue silk, and cover it with a covering of badgerâ€™s skins, and put to the bars thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take all the instruments of the ministry, wherewith they minister in the Sanctuary, and put them in a cloth of blue silk, and cover them with a covering of badgerâ€™s skins, and put them on the bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth upon it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall put upon it all the instruments thereof, which they occupy about it, the censers, the fleshhooks, and the besoms, and the basins, even all the instruments of the altar: and they shall spread upon it a covering of badgerâ€™s skins, and put to the bars of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron and his sons have made an end of covering the Sanctuary, and all the instruments of the Sanctuary, at the removing of the host, afterward the sons of Kohath shall come to bear it, but they shall not touch any holy thing lest they die. This is the charge of the sons of Kohath in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the office of Eleazar the son of Aaron the Priest pertaineth the oil for the light, and the sweet incense, and the daily meat offering, and the anointing oil with the oversight of all the Tabernacle, and of all that therein is, both in the Sanctuary, and in all the instruments thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall not cut off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thus do unto them that they may live and not die, when they come near to the most holy things: let Aaron and his sons come and appoint them, every one to his office, and to his charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let them not go in, to see when the Sanctuary is folden up, lest they die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take also the sum of the sons of Gershon, every one by the houses of their fathers, throughout their families:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and above until fifty years old shalt thou number them, all that enter into the assembly for to do service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be the service of the families of the Gershonites to serve and to bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall bear the curtains of the Tabernacle, and the Tabernacle of the Congregation, his covering, and the covering of badgerâ€™s skins, that is on high upon it, and the veil of the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtains also of the court, and the veil of the entering in of the gate of the court, which is near the Tabernacle and near the altar round about, with their cords: and all the instruments for their service, and all that is made for them: so shall they serve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the commandment of Aaron and his sons shall all the service of the sons of the Gershonites be done, in all their charges and in all their service, and ye shall appoint them to keep all their charges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and their watch shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt number the sons of Merari by their families, and by the houses of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and above, even unto fifty years old shalt thou number them, all that enter into the assembly, to do the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is their office and charge according to all their service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation: the boards of the Tabernacle with the bars thereof, and his pillars, and his sockets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the pillars round about the court, with their sockets and their pins, and their cords with all their instruments, even for all their service: and by name ye shall reckon the instruments of their office and charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron and the princes of the Congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites, by their families and by the houses of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and above, even unto fifty years old, all that enter into the assembly for the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the numbers of them throughout their families were two thousand, seven hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbers of the families of the Kohathites, all that serve in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, which Moses and Aaron did number according to the commandment of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the numbers of the sons of Gershon throughout their families and houses of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and upward, even unto fifty years old: all that enter into the assembly for the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the numbers of them by their families, and by the houses of their fathers were two thousand six hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbers of the families of the sons of Gershon: of all that did service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, whom Moses and Aaron did number according to the commandment of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The numbers also of the families of the sons of Merari by their families, and by the houses of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and upward, even unto fifty years old: all that enter into the assembly for the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the numbers of them by their families were three thousand, and two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sums of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the Lord, by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the numbers of the Levites, which Moses, and Aaron, and the princes of Israel numbered by their families and by the houses of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old and upward, even to fifty years old, every one that came to do his duty, office, service and charge in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the number of them were eight thousand five hundred and four score.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the commandment of the Lord by the hand of Moses did Aaron number them, every one according to his service, and according to his charge. Thus were they of that tribe numbered, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the children of Israel that they put out of the host every leper, and every one that hath an issue, and whosoever is defiled by the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both male and female shall ye put out: out of the host shall ye put them, that they defile not their tents among whom I dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel did so, and put them out of the host, even as the Lord had commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, When a man or woman shall commit any sin that men commit, and transgress against the Lord, when that person shall trespass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall confess their sin which they have done, and shall restore the damage thereof with his principal, and put the fifth part of it more thereto, and shall give it unto him, against whom he hath trespassed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man have no kinsman, to whom he should restore the damage, the damage shall be restored to the Lord for the Priestâ€™s use, besides the ram of the atonement, whereby he shall make atonement for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they bring unto the Priest, shallbe his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every manâ€™s hallowed things shall be his: that is, whatsoever any man giveth the Priest, it shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any manâ€™s wife turn to evil, and commit a trespass against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that another man lie with her fleshly, and it be hid from the eyes of her husband, and kept close, and yet she be defiled, and there be no witness against her, neither she taken with the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he be moved with a jealous mind, so that he is jealous over his wife, which is defiled, or if he have a jealous mind, so that he is jealous over his wife, which is not defiled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the man bring his wife to the Priest, and bring her offering with her, the tenth part of an Ephah of barley meal, but he shall not pour oil upon it, nor put incense thereon: for it is an offering of jealousy, an offering for a remembrance, calling the sin to mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Priest shall bring her, and set her before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Priest shall take the holy water in an earthen vessel, and of the dust that is in the floor of the Tabernacle, even the Priest shall take it and put it into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Priest shall set the woman before the Lord, and uncover the womanâ€™s head, and put the offering of the memorial in her hands: it is the jealousy offering, and the Priest shall have bitter and cursed water in his hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Priest shall charge her by an oath, and say unto the woman, If no man have lain with thee, neither thou hast turned to uncleanness from thine husband, be free from this bitter and cursed water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if thou hast turned from thine husband, and so art defiled, and some man hath lain with thee besides thine husband,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Then the Priest shall charge the woman with an oath of cursing, and the Priest shall say unto the woman:) The Lord make thee to be accursed, and detestable for the oath among the people, and the Lord cause thy thigh to rot, and thy belly to swell:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that this cursed water may go into thy bowels, to cause thy belly to swell, and thy thigh to rot. Then the woman shall answer, Amen, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, the Priest shall write these curses in a book, and shall blot them out with the bitter water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall cause the woman to drink the bitter and cursed water, and the cursed water turned into bitterness shall enter into her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Priest shall take the jealousy offering out of the womanâ€™s hand, and shall shake the offering before the Lord, and offer it upon the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Priest shall take an handful of the offering for a memorial thereof, and burn it upon the altar, and afterward make the woman drink the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he hath made her drink the water, if she be defiled and have trespassed against her husband, then shall the cursed water, turned into bitterness, enter into her, and her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall rot, and the woman shall be accursed among her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the woman be not defiled, but be clean, she shall be free, and shall conceive and bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law of jealousy, when a wife turneth from her husband and is defiled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or, when a man is moved with a jealous mind, being jealous over his wife, then shall he bring the woman before the Lord, and the Priest shall do to her according to all this law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man shall be free from sin, but this woman shall bear her iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When a man or a woman doth separate themselves to vow a vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself unto the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall abstain from wine and strong drink, and shall drink no sour wine nor sour drink, nor shall drink any liquor of grapes, neither shall eat fresh grapes nor dried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as his abstinence endureth, shall he eat nothing that is made of the wine of the vine, neither the kernels nor the husk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he is separated by his vow, the razor shall not come upon his head, until the days be out, in the which he separateth himself unto the Lord, he shall be holy, and shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the time that he separateth himself unto the Lord, he shall come at no dead body:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not make himself unclean at the death of his father or mother, brother, or sister: for the consecration of his God is upon his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of his separation he shall be holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any die suddenly by him, or he beware, then the head of his consecration shall be defiled, and he shall shave his head in the day of his cleansing: in the seventh day he shall shave it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the eighth day he shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons to the Priest, at the door of the tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Priest shall prepare the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and shall make an atonement for him, because he sinned by the dead: so shall he hallow his head the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall consecrate unto the Lord the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of a year old for a trespass offering, and the first days shall be void: for his consecration was defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This then is the law of the Nazirite: when the time of his consecration is out, he shall come to the door of the tabernacle of the Congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall bring his offering unto the Lord, an he lamb of a year old without blemish, for a burnt offering, and a she lamb of a year old without blemish, for a sin offering, and a ram without blemish, for peace offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a basket of unleavened bread, of Cakes of fine flour, mingled with oil, and wafers of unleavened bread anointed with oil, with their meat offering, and their drink offerings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The which the Priest shall bring before the Lord, and make his sin offering and his burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall prepare also the ram for a peace offering unto the Lord, with the basket of unleavened bread, and the Priest shall make his meat offering, and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Nazirite shall shave the head of his consecration at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and shall take the hair of the head of his consecration, and put it in the fire which is under the peace offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram, and an unleavened cake out of the basket, and a wafer unleavened, and put them upon the hands of the Nazirite, after he hath shaven his consecration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Priest shall shake them to and fro before the Lord: this is an holy thing for the Priest besides the shaken breast, and besides the heave shoulder: so afterward the Nazirite may drink wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law of the Nazirite, which he hath vowed, and of his offering unto the Lord for his consecration, besides that that he is able to bring: according to the vow which he vowed, so shall he do after the law of his consecration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, Thus shall ye bless the children of Israel, and say unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord bless thee, and keep thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord make his face shine upon thee, and be merciful unto thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall put my Name upon the children of Israel, and I will bless them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Moses had finished the setting up of the Tabernacle, and anointed it and sanctified it, and all the instruments thereof, and the altar with all the instruments thereof, and had anointed them, and sanctified them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the princes of Israel, heads over the houses of their fathers, (they were the princes of the tribes, who were over them that were numbered) offered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brought their offering before the Lord, six covered chariots, and twelve oxen: one chariot for two princes, and for every one an ox, and they offered them before the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take these of them, that they may be to do the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and thou shalt give them unto the Levites, to every man according unto his office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the chariots and the oxen, and gave them unto the Levites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two chariots and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according unto their office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And four chariots and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according unto their office, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because the charge of the Sanctuary belonged to them, which they did bear upon their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes also offered in the dedication for the altar in the day that it was anointed: then the princes offered their offering before the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, One prince one day, and another prince another day, shall offer their offering, for the dedication of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then on the first day did Nahshon the son of Amminadab of the tribe of Judah offer his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An incense cup of gold of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for peace offerings, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, and five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second day Nethanel, the son of Zuar, prince of the tribe of Issachar did offer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who offered for his offering a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An incense cup of gold of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for peace offerings two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third day Eliab the son of Helon prince of the children of Zebulun offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for peace offerings, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur prince of the children of Reuben offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, and five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, prince of the children of Simeon offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels: after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth day Eliasaph the son of Deuel prince of the children of Gad offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud prince of the children of Ephraim offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth day offered Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, prince of the children of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni prince of the children of Benjamin offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ocran, prince of the children of Asher offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a peace offering, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old: this was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ocran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali offered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was a silver charger of an hundred and thirty shekels weight, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine flour, mingled with oil, for a meat offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young bullock, a ram, a lamb of a year old for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for peace offerings, two bullocks, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of a year old, this was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the dedication of the Altar by the princes of Israel, when it was anointed, twelve chargers of silver, twelve silver bowls: twelve incense cups of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every charger containing an hundred and thirty shekels of silver, and every bowl seventy: all the silver vessel contained two thousand and four hundred shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve incense cups of gold full of incense, containing ten shekels every cup, after the shekel of the Sanctuary: and the gold of the incense cups was an hundred and twenty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the bullocks for the burnt offering were twelve bullocks, the rams twelve, the lambs of a year old twelve, with their meat offerings, and twelve he goats for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the bullocks for the peace offerings were four and twenty bullocks, the rams sixty, the he goats sixty, the lambs of a year old sixty: this was the dedication of the Altar, after that it was anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses went into the tabernacle of the Congregation to speak with God, he heard the voice of one speaking unto him from the Mercy seat, that was upon the Ark of the Testimony between the two Cherubims, and he spake unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto Aaron, and say unto him, When thou lightest the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light toward the forefront of the Candlestick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron did so, lighting the lamps thereof toward the forefront of the Candlestick, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was the work of the Candlestick, even of gold beaten out with the hammer, both the shaft, and the flower thereof was beaten out with the hammer: according to the pattern which the Lord had showed Moses, so made he the Candlestick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the Levites from among the children of Israel, and purify them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus shalt thou do unto them, when thou purifiest them, Sprinkle water of purification upon them, and let them shave all their flesh, and wash their clothes: so they shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall take a young bullock with his meat offering of fine flour, mingled with oil, and another young bullock shalt thou take for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then thou shalt bring the Levites before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and assemble all the Congregation of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt bring the Levites also before the Lord, and the children of Israel shall put their hands upon the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall offer the Levites before the Lord, as a shake offering of the children of Israel, that they may execute the service of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites shall put their hands upon the heads of the bullocks, and make thou the one a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering unto the Lord, that thou mayest make an atonement for the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set the Levites before Aaron and before his sons, and offer them as a shake offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus thou shalt separate the Levites from among the children of Israel, and the Levites shall be mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward shall the Levites go in, to serve in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and thou shalt purify them, and offer them as a shake offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are freely given unto me from among the children of Israel, for such as open any womb: for all the firstborn of the children of Israel have I taken them unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the firstborn of the children of Israel are mine, both of man and beast: since the day that I smote every firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have taken the Levites for all the firstborn of the children of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And have given the Levites as a gift unto Aaron, and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and to make an atonement for the children of Israel, that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come near unto the Sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron and all the Congregation of the children of Israel did with the Levites, according unto all that the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites: so did the children of Israel unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levites were purified, and washed their clothes, and Aaron offered them as a shake offering before the Lord, and Aaron made an atonement for them, to purify them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that, went the Levites in to do their service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, before Aaron and before his sons: as the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also belongeth to the Levites: from five and twenty years old and upward, they shall go in, to execute their office in the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the age of fifty years, they shall cease from executing the office, and shall serve no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shall minister with their brethren in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, to keep things committed to their charge, but they shall do no service: thus shalt thou do unto the Levites touching their charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year, after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel shall also celebrate the Passover at the time appointed thereunto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourteenth day of this month at even, ye shall keep it in his due season: according to all the ordinances of it, and according to all the ceremonies thereof shall ye keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spake unto the children of Israel, to celebrate the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept the Passover in the fourteenth day of the first month at even in the wilderness of Sinai: according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain men were defiled by a dead man, that they might not keep the Passover the same day: and they came before Moses and before Aaron the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those men said unto him, We are defiled by a dead man: wherefore are we kept back that we may not offer an offering unto the Lord in the time thereunto appointed among the children of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said unto them, Stand still, and I will hear what the Lord will command concerning you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say, If any among you, or of your posterity shall be unclean by the reason of a corpse, or be in a long journey, he shall keep the Passover unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourteenth day of the second month at even they shall keep it: with unleavened bread, and sour herbs shall they eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall leave none of it unto the morning, nor break any bone of it: according to all the ordinance of the Passover shall they keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man that is clean and is not in a journey, and is negligent to keep the Passover, the same person shall be cut off from his people: because he brought not the offering of the Lord in his due season, that man shall bear his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a stranger dwell among you, and will keep the Passover unto the Lord, as the ordinance of the Passover, and as the manner thereof is, so shall he do: ye shall have one law both for the stranger, and for him that was born in the same land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Tabernacle was reared up, a cloud covered the Tabernacle, namely, the Tabernacle of the Testimony: and at even there was upon the Tabernacle, as the appearance of fire until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the cloud was taken up from the Tabernacle, then afterward the children of Israel journeyed: and in the place where the cloud abode, there the children of Israel pitched their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the commandment of the Lord the children of Israel journeyed, and at the commandment of the Lord they pitched: as long as the cloud abode upon the Tabernacle, they lay still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the cloud tarried still upon the Tabernacle a long time, the children of Israel kept the watch of the Lord, and journeyed not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the cloud abode a few days upon the Tabernacle, they abode in their tents according to the commandment of the Lord: for they journeyed at the commandment of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though the cloud abode upon the Tabernacle from even unto the morning, yet if the cloud was taken up in the morning, then they journeyed: whether by day or by night the cloud was taken up, then they journeyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if the cloud tarried two days, or a month, or a year upon the Tabernacle, abiding thereon, the children of Israel abode still, and journeyed not: but when it was taken up, they journeyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the commandment of the Lord they pitched, and at the commandment of the Lord they journeyed, keeping the watch of the Lord at the commandment of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make thee two trumpets of silver: of an whole piece shalt thou make them, that thou mayest use them for the assembling of the Congregation, and for the departure of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they shall blow with them, all the Congregation shall assemble to thee, before the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they blow with one, then the Princes, or heads over the thousands of Israel shall come unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye blow an alarm, then the camp of them that pitch on the East part, shall go forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye blow an alarm the second time, then the host of them that lie on the South side, shall march: for they shall blow an alarm when they remove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the assembling the Congregation, ye shall blow without an alarm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Aaron the Priest shall blow the trumpets, and ye shall have them as a law forever in your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye go to war in your land against the enemy that vexeth you, ye shall blow an alarm with the trumpets, and ye shall be remembered before the Lord your God, and shall be saved from your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also in the day of your gladness, and in your feast days, and in the beginning of your months, ye shall also blow the trumpets over your burnt sacrifices, and over your peace offerings, that they may be a remembrance for you before your God: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the second year, in the second month, and in the twentieth day of the month, the cloud was taken up from the Tabernacle of the Testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel departed on their journeys out of the desert of Sinai, and the cloud rested in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they first took their journey at the commandment of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first place went the standard of the host of the children of Judah according to their armies: and Nahshon the son of Amminadab was over his band.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the children of Issachar was Nethanel the son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Tabernacle was taken down, then the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari went forward bearing the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, departed the standard of the host of Reuben, according to their armies, and over his band was Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the children of Gad was Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Kohathites also went forward and bare the Sanctuary, and the former did set up the Tabernacle against they came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the standard of the host of the children of Ephraim went forward according to their armies, and over his band was Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin was Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last, the standard of the host of the children of Dan marched, gathering all the hosts according to their armies: and over his band was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the children of Asher was Pagiel the son of Ocran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the band of the tribe of the children of Naphtali was Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the removings of the children of Israel according to their armies, when they marched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, Moses said unto Hobab the son of Reuel the Midianite, the father-in-law of Moses, We go into the place, of which the Lord said, I will give it you. Come thou with us, and we will do thee good: for the Lord hath promised good unto Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered him, I will not go: but I will depart to mine own country, and to my kindred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, I pray thee, leave us not: for thou knowest our camping places in the wilderness: therefore thou mayest be our guide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thou go with us, what goodness the Lord shall show unto us, the same will we show unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they departed from the mount of the Lord, three daysâ€™ journey: and the Ark of the covenant of the Lord went before them in the three daysâ€™ journey, to search out a resting place for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cloud of the Lord was upon them by day, when they went out of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Ark went forward, Moses said, Rise up Lord, and let thine enemies be scattered, and let them that hate thee, flee before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it rested, he said, Return, O Lord, to the many thousands of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people became murmurers, it displeased the Lord: and the Lord heard it, therefore his wrath was kindled, and the fire of the Lord burnt among them, and consumed the utmost part of the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people cried unto Moses: and when Moses prayed unto the Lord, the fire was quenched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of the place Taberah, because the fire of the Lord burnt among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a number of people that was among them, fell a lusting, and turned away, and the children of Israel also wept, and said, Who shall give us flesh to eat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We remember the fish which we did eat in Egypt for nought, the cucumbers, and the pepons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now our soul is dried away, we can see nothing but this Manna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Manna also was as coriander seed, and his color like the color of bdellium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people went about and gathered, and ground it in mills, or beat it in mortars, and baked it in a cauldron, and made cakes of it, and the taste of it was like unto the taste of fresh oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the dew fell down upon the host in night, the Manna fell with it.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses heard the people weep throughout their families, every man in the door of his tent, and the wrath of the Lord was grievously kindled: also Moses was grieved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the Lord, Wherefore hast thou vexed thy servant? and why have I not found favor in thy sight, seeing thou hast put the charge of all this people upon me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I conceived all this people? or have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom (as a nurse beareth the sucking child) unto the land, for the which thou swarest unto their fathers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where should I have flesh to give unto all this people? for they weep unto me, saying, Give us flesh that we may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not able to bear all this people alone, for it is too heavy for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if thou deal thus with me, I pray thee, if I have found favor in thy sight, kill me, that I behold not my misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Gather unto me seventy men of the Elders of Israel, whom thou knowest, that they are the Elders of the people, and governors over them, and bring them unto the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and let them stand there with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will come down, and talk with thee there, and take of the Spirit, which is upon thee, and put upon them, and they shall bear the burden of the people with thee: so thou shalt not bear it alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore thou shalt say unto the people, Be sanctified against tomorrow, and ye shall eat flesh: for you have wept in the ears of the Lord, saying, Who shall give us flesh to eat? for we were better in Egypt: therefore the Lord will give you flesh, and ye shall eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall not eat one day nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and be loathsome unto you, because ye have contemned the Lord, which is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we hither out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Six hundred thousand footmen are there of the people, among whom I am: and thou sayest, I will give them flesh, that they may eat a month long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall the sheep and the beeves be slain for them to find them? either shall all the fish of the Sea be gathered together for them to suffice them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Is the Lordâ€™s hand shortened? thou shalt see now whether my word shall come to pass unto thee, or no.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out, and told the people the words of the Lord, and gathered seventy men of the Elders of the people, and set them round about the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down in a cloud, and spake unto him, and took of the Spirit that was upon him, and put it upon the seventy Ancient men: and when the Spirit rested upon them, then they prophesied, and did not cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there remained two of the men in the host: the name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad, and the Spirit rested upon them, (for they were of them that were written, and went not out unto the Tabernacle) and they prophesied in the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun the servant of Moses one of his young men answered and said, My lord Moses, forbid them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said unto him, Enviest thou for my sake? yea, would God that all the Lordâ€™s people were Prophets, and that the Lord would put his spirit upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses returned into the host, he and the Elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there went forth a wind from the Lord, and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall upon the camp, a dayâ€™s journey on this side, and a dayâ€™s journey on the other side, round about the host, and they were about two cubits above the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people arose, all that day, and all the night, and all the next day, and gathered the quails: he that gathered the least, gathered ten Homers full, and they spread them abroad for their use round about the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the flesh was yet between their teeth, before it was chewed, even the wrath of the Lord was kindled against the people, and the Lord smote the people with an exceeding great plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the name of the place was called, Kibroth Hattaavah: for there they buried the people that fell a lusting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kibroth Hattaavah the people took their journey to Hazeroth, and abode at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Miriam and Aaron spake against Moses, because of the woman of Ethiopia whom he had married (for he had married a woman of Ethiopia.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, What? hath the Lord spoken but only by Moses? hath he not spoken also by us? and the Lord heard this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (But Moses was a very meek man above all the men that were upon the earth.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by and by the Lord said unto Moses, and unto Aaron, and unto Miriam, come out ye three unto the Tabernacle of the Congregation: and they three came forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down in the pillar of the cloud, and stood in the door of the Tabernacle, and called Aaron and Miriam, and they both came forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Hear now my words, If there be a Prophet of the Lord among you, I will be known to him by a vision, and will speak unto him by dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My servant Moses is not so, who is faithful in all mine house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto him will I speak mouth to mouth, and by vision, and not in dark words, but he shall see the similitude of the Lord. Wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant, even against Moses?
verses.speaker: Narrator
