verses.text: Thus the Lord was very angry with them, and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the cloud departed from the Tabernacle: and behold, Miriam was leprous like snow: and Aaron looked upon Miriam, and behold, she was leprous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron said unto Moses, Alas, my lord, I beseech thee, lay not the sin upon us, which we have foolishly committed, and wherein we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let her not, I pray thee, be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed, when he cometh out of his motherâ€™s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses cried unto the Lord, saying, O God, I beseech thee, heal her now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, If her father had spit in her face, should she not have been ashamed seven days? let her be shut out of the host seven days, and after she shall be received.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was shut out of the host seven days, and the people removed not, till Miriam was brought in again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then afterward the people removed from Hazeroth, and pitched in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send thou men out to search the land of Canaan which I give unto the children of Israel: of every tribe of their fathers shall ye send a man, such as are all rulers among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses sent them out of the wilderness of Paran at the commandment of the Lord: all those men were heads of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also their names are these: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Joseph, to wit, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men, which Moses sent to spy out the land: and Moses called the name of Hoshea the son of Nun, Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, Go up this way toward the South, and go up into the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And consider the land what it is, and the people that dwell therein, whether they be strong, or weak, either few or many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also what the land is that they dwell in, whether it be good or bad: and what cities they be, that they dwell in, whether they dwell in tents, or in walled towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what the land is: whether it be fat or lean, whether there be trees therein, or not. And be of good courage, and bring of the fruit of the land (for then was the time of the first ripe grapes.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up, and searched out the land, from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, to go to Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they ascended toward the South, and came unto Hebron, where were Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the sons of Anak. And Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to the river of Eshcol, and cut down thence a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bare it upon a bar between two, and brought of the pomegranates and of the figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That place was called the river Eshcol, because of the cluster of grapes, which the children of Israel cut down thence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after forty days they turned again from searching of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and came to Moses and to Aaron, and unto all the Congregation of the children of Israel, in the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh, and brought to them, and to all the Congregation tidings, and showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, and said, We came unto the land whither thou hast sent us, and surely it floweth with milk and honey: and here is of the fruit of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the people be strong that dwell in the land, and the cities are walled and exceeding great: and moreover, we saw the sons of Anak there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amalekites dwell in the South country, and the Hittites, and the Jebusites, and the Amorites dwell in the mountains, and the Canaanites dwell by the sea, and by the coasts of Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, Let us go up at once, and possess it: for undoubtedly we shall overcome it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men that went up with him, said, We be not able to go up against the people: for they are stronger than we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought up an evil report of the land which they had searched for the children of Israel, saying, The land which we have gone through to search it out, is a land that eateth up the inhabitants thereof: for all the people that we saw in it, are men of great stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there we saw giants, the sons of Anak, which come of the giants, so that we seemed in our sight like grasshoppers: and so we were in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the Congregation lifted up their voice, and cried: and the people wept that night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron: and the whole assembly said unto them, Would God we had died in the land of Egypt, or in this wilderness: would God we were dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore now hath the Lord brought us into this land to fall upon the sword? our wives and our children shall be a prey: were it not better for us to return into Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said one to another, Let us make a captain and return into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the Congregation of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh two of them that searched the land, rent their clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And spake unto all the assembly of the children of Israel, saying, The land which we walked through to search it, is a very good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord love us, he will bring us into this land, and give it us, which is a land that floweth with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rebel not ye against the Lord, neither fear ye the people of the land: for they are but bread for us: their shield is departed from them, and the Lord is with us, fear them not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the multitude said, Stone them with stones: but the glory of the Lord appeared in the Tabernacle of the Congregation before all the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, How long will this people provoke me, and how long will it be ere they believe me, for all the signs which I have showed among them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will smite them with the pestilence and destroy them, and will make thee a greater nation and mightier than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said unto the Lord, When the Egyptians shall hear it, (for thou broughtest this people by thy power from among them)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall say to the inhabitants of the land, (for they have heard, that thou Lord, art among this people, and that thou, Lord, art seen face to face, and that thy cloud standeth over them, and that thou goest before them, by daytime in a pillar of a cloud, and in a pillar of fire by night.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That thou wilt kill this people as one man: so the heathen which have heard the fame of thee, shall thus say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Lord was not able to bring this people into the land which he sware unto them, therefore hath he slain them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is slow to anger, and of great mercy, and forgiving iniquity and sin, but not making the wicked innocent, and visiting the wickedness of the fathers upon the children, in the third and fourth generation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, I beseech thee, unto the iniquity of this people, according to thy great mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people from Egypt, even until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, I have forgiven it, according to thy request.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, as I live, all the earth, shall be filled with the glory of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all those men which have seen my glory, and my miracles which I did in Egypt, and in the wilderness, and have tempted me this ten times, and have not obeyed my voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly they shall not see the land, whereof I sware unto their fathers: neither shall any that provoke me, see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit, and hath followed me still, even him will I bring into the land, whither he went, and his seed shall inherit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites remain in the valley: wherefore turn back tomorrow, and get you into the wilderness, by the way of the red sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, the Lord spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long shall I suffer this wicked multitude to murmur against me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, As I live (saith the Lord) I will surely do unto you, even as ye have spoken in mine ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your carcasses shall fall in this wilderness, and all you that were counted through all your numbers, from twenty years old and above, which have murmured against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall not doubtless come into the land, for the which I lifted up mine hand, to make you dwell therein, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your children (which ye said should be a prey) them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have refused:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even your carcasses shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and shall bear your whoredoms, until your carcasses be wasted in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the number of the days in the which ye searched out the land, even forty days, every day for a year, shall you bear your iniquity, for forty years, and ye shall feel my breach of promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I the Lord have said, Certainly I will do so to all this wicked company that are gathered together against me: for in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men which Moses had sent to search the land (which when they came again, made all the people to murmur against him, and brought up a slander upon the land.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even those men that did bring up that vile slander upon the land, shall die by a plague before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, of those men that went to search the land, shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses told these sayings unto all the children of Israel, and the people sorrowed greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up early in the morning, and got them up into the top of the mountain, saying, Lo, we be ready to go up to the place which the Lord hath promised: for we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, Wherefore transgress ye thus the commandment of the Lord? it will not so come well to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go not up, (for the Lord is not among you) lest ye be overthrown before your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: for inasmuch as ye are turned away from the Lord, the Lord also will not be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they presumed obstinately to go up to the top of the mountain: but the Ark of the covenant of the Lord, and Moses departed not out of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites, which dwelt in that mountain, came down and smote them, and consumed them unto Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land of your habitations which I give unto you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And will make an offering by fire unto the Lord, a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or a free offering, or in your feasts to make a sweet savor unto the Lord, of the herd or of the flock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let him that offereth his offering unto the Lord, bring a meat offering of a tenth deal of fine flour, mingled with the fourth part of an Hin of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also thou shalt prepare the fourth part of an Hin of wine to be poured on a lamb appointed for the burnt offering, or any offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a ram thou shalt for a meat offering, prepare two tenth deals of fine flour, mingled with the third part of an Hin of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a drink offering thou shalt offer the third part of an Hin of wine, for a sweet savor unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering, or for a sacrifice to fulfill a vow or a peace offering to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let him offer with the bullock a meat offering of three tenth deals of fine flour, mingled with half an Hin of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt bring for a drink offering half an Hin of wine, for an offering made by fire of a sweet savor unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall it be done for a bullock, or for a ram, or for a lamb, or for a kid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number that ye prepare to offer, so shall ye do to everyone according to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that are born of the country, shall do these things thus, to offer an offering made by fire of sweet savor unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever be among you in your generations, and will make an offering by fire of a sweet savor unto the Lord, as ye do, so he shall do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One ordinance shall be both for you of the Congregation, and also for the stranger that dwelleth with you, even an ordinance forever in your generations: as you are, so shall the stranger be before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One law and one manner shall serve both for you and for the stranger that sojourneth with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land, to the which I bring you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye shall eat of the bread of the land, ye shall offer an heave offering unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heave offering: as the heave offering of the barn, so ye shall lift it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the Lord an heave offering in your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye have erred, and not observed all these commandments, which the Lord hath spoken unto Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even all that the Lord hath commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the first day that the Lord commanded Moses, and hence forward among your generations:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if so be that ought be committed ignorantly of the Congregation, then all the Congregation shall give a bullock for a burnt offering, for a sweet savor unto the Lord, with the meat offering and drink offering thereto, according to the manner, and an he goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Priest shall make an atonement for all the Congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them: for it is ignorance: and they shall bring their offering for an offering made by fire unto the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord for their ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall be forgiven all the Congregation of the children of Israel, and the stranger that dwelleth among them: for all the people were in ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any one person sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of a year old for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Priest shall make an atonement for the ignorant person, when he sinneth by ignorance before the Lord, to make reconciliation for him: and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is born among the children of Israel, and the stranger that dwelleth among them, shall have both one law, who so doth sin by ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be born in the land, or a stranger, the same blasphemeth the Lord: therefore that person shall be cut off from among his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he hath despised the word of the Lord, and hath broken his commandment: that person shall be utterly cut off: his iniquity shall be upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man that gathered sticks upon the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that found him gathering sticks, brought him unto Moses and to Aaron, and unto all the Congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put him ward: for it was not declared what should be done unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, This man shall die the death: and let all the multitude stone him with stones without the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the Congregation brought him without the host, and stoned him with stones, and he died, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes upon the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and put upon the fringes of the borders a ribbon of blue silk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall have the fringes that when ye look upon them, ye may remember all the commandments of the Lord, and do them: and that ye seek not after your own heart, nor after your own eyes, after the which ye go a whoring;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That ye may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Korah the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi went apart with Dathan, and Abiram the son of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, the sons of Reuben:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up against Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty captains of the assembly, famous in the Congregation, and men of renown,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who gathered themselves together against Moses, and against Aaron, and said unto them, Ye take too much upon you, seeing all the Congregation is holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them: wherefore then lift ye yourselves above the Congregation of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Moses heard it, he fell upon his face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And spake to Korah and unto all his company, saying, Tomorrow the Lord will show who is his, and who is holy, and who ought to approach near unto him: and whom he hath chosen, he will cause to come near to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This do therefore, Take you censers, both Korah and all his company,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And put fire therein, and put incense in them before the Lord tomorrow: and the man whom the Lord doth choose, the same shall be holy: ye take too much upon you, ye sons of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Moses said unto Korah, Hear, I pray you, ye sons of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seemeth it a small thing unto you, that the God of Israel hath separated you from the multitude of Israel, to take you near to himself, to do the service of the Tabernacle of the Lord, and to stand before the Congregation, and to minister unto them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath also taken thee to him, and all thy brethren, the sons of Levi with thee, and seek ye the office of the Priest also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which cause, thou, and all thy company are gathered together against the Lord: and what is Aaron, that ye murmur against him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent to call Dathan, and Abiram the sons of Eliab: who answered, We will not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it a small thing that thou hast brought us out of a land that floweth with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, except thou make thyself lord and ruler over us also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also thou hast not brought us unto a land that floweth with milk and honey, neither given us inheritance of fields and vineyards: wilt thou put out the eyes of these men? we will not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses waxed very angry, and said unto the Lord, Look not unto their offering: I have not taken so much as an ass from them, neither have I hurt any of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Korah, Be thou and all thy company before the Lord: both thou, they, and Aaron tomorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And take every man his censer, and put incense in them, and bring ye every man his censer before the Lord, two hundred and fifty censers: thou also and Aaron, every one his censer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took every man his censer, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood in the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation with Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Korah gathered all the multitude against them unto the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation: then the glory of the Lord appeared unto all the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Separate yourselves from among this Congregation, that I may consume them at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fell upon their faces and said, O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, hath not one man only sinned, and wilt thou be wroth with all the Congregation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the Congregation, and say, Get you away from about the Tabernacle of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses rose up, and went unto Dathan and Abiram, and the Elders of Israel followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake unto the Congregation, saying, Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest ye perish in all their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they got them away from the Tabernacle of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram on every side: and Dathan and Abiram came out and stood in the door of their tents, with their wives, and their sons, and their little children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Hereby ye shall know that the Lord hath sent me to do all these works: for I have not done them of mine own mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men, the Lord hath not sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the Lord make a new thing, and the earth open her mouth, and swallow them up with all that they have, and they go down quick into the pit: then ye shall understand that these men have provoked the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he had made an end of speaking all the words, even the ground clave asunder that was under them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up with their families, and all the men that were with Korah, and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they and all that they had, went down alive into the pit, and the earth covered them: so they perished from among the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Israel that were about them, fled at the cry of them: for they said, Let us flee, lest the earth swallow us up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there came out a fire from the Lord, and consumed the two hundred and fifty men that offered the incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the Priest, that he take up the censers out of the burning, and scatter the fire beyond the altar: for they are hallowed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The censers, I say, of these sinners, that destroyed themselves: and let them make of them broad plates for a covering of the Altar: for they offered them before the Lord, therefore they shall be holy, and they shall be a sign unto the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eleazar the Priest took the brazen censers, which they that were burnt had offered, and made broad plates of them for a covering of the Altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a remembrance unto the children of Israel, that no stranger which is not of the seed of Aaron, come near to offer incense before the Lord, that he be not like Korah and his company, as the Lord said to him by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the morrow all the multitude of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, Ye have killed the people of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Congregation was gathered against Moses and against Aaron, then they turned their faces toward the tabernacle of the Congregation: and behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of the Lord appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron were come before the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get you up from among this Congregation: for I will consume them quickly: then they fell upon their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take the censer and put fire therein of the Altar, and put therein incense, and go quickly unto the Congregation, and make an atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out from the Lord: the plague is begun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron took as Moses commanded him, and ran into the midst of the Congregation, and behold, the plague was begun among the people, and he put incense, and made an atonement for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he stood between the dead, and them that were alive, the plague was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they died of this plague fourteen thousand and seven hundred, beside them that died in the conspiracy of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron went again unto Moses before the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the plague was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and take of every one of them a rod, after the house of their fathers, of all their princes according to the family of their fathers, even twelve rods: and thou shalt write every manâ€™s name upon his rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And write Aaronâ€™s name upon the rod of Levi: for every rod shall be for the head of the house of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put them in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, before the Ark of the testimony, where I will declare myself to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the manâ€™s rod, whom I choose, shall blossom: and I will make cease from me the grudgings of the children of Israel, which grudge against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spake unto the children of Israel, and all their Princes gave him a rod, one rod for every prince, according to the houses of their fathers, even twelve rods, and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses laid the rods before the Lord in the Tabernacle of the Testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses on the morrow went into the Tabernacle of the Testimony, behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and brought forth buds, and brought forth blossoms, and bare ripe almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought out all the rods from before the Lord unto all the children of Israel: and they looked upon them, and took every man his rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, the Lord said unto Moses, Bring Aaronâ€™s rod again before the Testimony to be kept for a token to the rebellious children, and thou shalt cause their murmurings to cease from me, that they die not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did as the Lord had commanded him: so did he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel spake unto Moses, saying, Behold, we are dead, we perish, we are all lost:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever cometh near or approacheth to the Tabernacle of the Lord, shall die: shall we be consumed and die?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Aaron, Thou, and thy sons, and thy fatherâ€™s house with thee, shall bear the iniquity of the Sanctuary: both thou and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your Priestâ€™s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring also with thee thy brethren of the tribe of Levi of the family of thy father which shall be joined with thee, and minister unto thee: but thou and thy sons with thee shall minister before the Tabernacle of the Testimony:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall keep my charge, even the charge of all the Tabernacle: but they shall not come near the instruments of the Sanctuary, nor to the altar, lest they die, both they and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall be joined with thee, and keep the charge of the Tabernacle of the Congregation for all the service of the Tabernacle: and no stranger shall come near unto you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall ye keep the charge of the Sanctuary, and the charge of the Altar: so there shall fall no more wrath upon the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For lo, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel, which as a gift of yours, are given unto the Lord, to do the service of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou, and thy sons with thee shall keep your Priestâ€™s office for all things of the Altar, and within the veil: therefore shall ye serve: for I have made your Priestâ€™s office an office of service: therefore the stranger that cometh near shall be slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spake unto Aaron, Behold, I have given thee the keeping of mine offerings, of all the hallowed things of the children of Israel: unto thee have I given them for the anointingâ€™s sake, and to thy sons for a perpetual ordinance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be thine of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: all their offering of all their meat offering, and of all their sin offering, and of all their trespass offering, which they bring unto me, that shall be most holy unto thee, and to thy sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the most holy place shalt thou eat it: every male shall eat of it: it is holy unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also shall be thine: the heave offering of their gift, with all the shake offerings of the children of Israel, I have given them unto thee, and to thy sons and to thy daughters with thee, to be a duty forever: all the clean in thine house shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the fat of the oil, and all the fat of the wine, and of the wheat, which they shall offer unto the Lord for their firstfruits, I have given them unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first ripe of all that is in their land, which they shall bring unto Lord shall be thine: all the clean in thine house shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything separate from the common use in Israel shall be thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that first openeth the matrix of any flesh, which they shall offer unto the Lord of man or beast, shall be thine: but the firstborn of man shalt thou redeem, and the firstborn of the unclean beast shalt thou redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that are to be redeemed, shalt thou redeem from the age of a month, according to thy estimation, for the money of five shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the firstborn of a cow, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat shalt thou not redeem: for they are holy: thou shalt sprinkle their blood at the altar, and thou shalt burn their fat: it is a sacrifice made by fire for a sweet savor unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the flesh of them shall be thine, as the shake breast, and as the right shoulder shall be thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the heave offerings of the holy things which the children of Israel shall offer unto the Lord, have I given thee, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee, to be a duty forever: it is a perpetual covenant of salt before the Lord, to thee, and to thy seed with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Aaron, Thou shalt have none inheritance in their land: neither shalt thou have any part among them: I am thy part and thine inheritance among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I have given the children of Levi all the tenth in Israel for an inheritance, for their service which they serve in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither shall the children of Israel any more come near the Tabernacle of the Congregation, lest they sustain sin, and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall do the service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and they shall bear their sin: it is a law forever in your generations, that among the children of Israel they possess none inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tithes of the children of Israel, which they shall offer as an offering unto the Lord, I have given the Levites for an inheritance, therefore I have said unto them, Among the children of Israel ye shall possess none inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak also unto the Levites, and say unto them, When ye shall take of the children of Israel the tithes, which I have given you of them for your inheritance, then shall ye take an heave offering of that same for the Lord, even the tenth part of the tithe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your heave offering shall be reckoned unto you, as the corn of the barn, or as the abundance of the winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ye shall also offer an heave offering unto the Lord of all your tithes, which ye shall receive of the children of Israel, and ye shall give thereof the Lordâ€™s heave offering to Aaron the Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall offer of all your gifts all the Lordâ€™s heave offerings: of all the fat of the same shall ye offer the holy things thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, When ye have offered the fat thereof, then it shall be counted unto the Levites, as the increase of the corn floor, or as the increase of the winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall eat it in all places, ye, and your households: for it is your wages for your service in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall bear no sin by the reason of it, when ye have offered the fat of it: neither shall ye pollute the holy things of the children of Israel, lest ye die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake to Moses, and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the ordinance of the Law, which the Lord hath commanded, saying, Speak unto the children of Israel that they bring thee a red cow without blemish, wherein is no spot, upon the which never came yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall give her unto Eleazar the Priest, that he may bring her without the host, and cause her to be slain before his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall Eleazar the Priest take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle it before the Tabernacle of the Congregation seven times,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cause the cow to be burnt in his sight: with her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, and her dung shall he burn her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the Priest take cedar wood, and hyssop, and scarlet lace, and cast them in the midst of the fire where the cow burneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the Priest wash his clothes, and he shall wash his flesh in water, and then come into the host, and the Priest shall be unclean unto the even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he that burneth her, shall wash his clothes in water, and wash his flesh in water, and be unclean until even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man, that is clean, shall take up the ashes of the cow, and put them without the host in a clean place: and it shall be kept for the Congregation of the children of Israel for a sprinkling water: it is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he that gathereth the ashes of the cow, shall wash his clothes, and remain unclean until even: and it shall be unto the children of Israel, and unto the stranger that dwelleth among them, a statute forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that toucheth the dead body of any man, shall be unclean even seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall purify himself therewith the third day, and the seventh day he shall be clean: but if he purify not himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever toucheth the corpse of any man that is dead, and purgeth not himself, defileth the Tabernacle of the Lord, and that person shall be cut off from Israel, because the sprinkling water was not sprinkled upon him: he shall be unclean, and his uncleanness shall remain still upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law, When a man dieth in a tent, all that come into the tent, and all that is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the vessels that be open, which have no covering fastened upon them, shall be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also whosoever toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the field, or a dead person, or a bone of a dead man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore for an unclean person, they shall take of the burnt ashes of the sin offering, and pure water shall be put thereto in a vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it upon the tent, and upon all the vessels, and on the persons that were therein, and upon him that touched the bone, or the slain, or the dead, or the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean the third day, and the seventh day, and he shall purify himself the seventh day, and wash his clothes, and wash himself in water, and shall be clean at even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man that is unclean, and purifieth not himself, that person shall be cut off from among the Congregation, because he hath defiled the Sanctuary of the Lord: and the sprinkling water hath not been sprinkled upon him: therefore shall he be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be a perpetual law unto them, that he that sprinkleth the sprinkling water, shall wash his clothes: also he that toucheth the sprinkling water, shall be unclean until even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatsoever the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean: and the person that toucheth him, shall be unclean until the even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel came with the whole Congregation to the desert of Zin in the first month, and the people abode at Kadesh: where Miriam died, and was buried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there was no water for the Congregation, and they assembled themselves against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people chode with Moses, and spake, saying, Would God we had perished when our brethren died before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have ye thus brought the Congregation of the Lord unto this wilderness, that both we and our cattle should die there?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore now have ye made us to come up from Egypt, to bring us into this miserable place, which is no place of seed, nor figs, nor vines, nor pomegranates? neither is there any water to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron went from the assembly unto the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and fell upon their faces: and the glory of the Lord appeared unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the rod, and gather thou and thy brother Aaron the Congregation together, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes, and it shall give forth his water, and thou shalt bring them water out of the rock: so thou shalt give the Congregation and the beasts drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses took the rod from before the Lord, as he had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron gathered the Congregation together before the rock: and Moses said unto them, Hear now ye rebels: shall we bring you water out of this rock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses lift up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice, and the water came out abundantly: so the Congregation, and their beasts drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the Lord spake unto Moses, and to Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the presence of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this Congregation into the land which I have given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the water of Meribah, because the children of Israel strove with the Lord, and he was sanctified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses sent messengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, saying, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the travail that we have had,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How our fathers went down into Egypt, and we dwelt in Egypt a long time, where the Egyptians handled us evil and our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when we cried unto the Lord, he heard our voice, and sent an Angel, and hath brought us out of Egypt, and behold, we are in the city Kadesh, in thine utmost border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray thee that we may pass through thy country: we will not go through the fields nor the vineyards, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the kingâ€™s way, and neither turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we be past thy borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Edom answered him, Thou shalt not pass by me, lest I come out against thee with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel said unto him, We will go up by the highway: and if I and my cattle drink of thy water, I will then pay for it: I will only (without any harm) go through on my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered again, Thou shalt not go through. Then Edom came out against him with much people, and with a mighty power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Edom denied to give Israel passage through his country: wherefore Israel turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the children of Israel with all the Congregation departed from Kadesh, they came unto mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and to Aaron in the mount Hor near the coast of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall be gathered unto his people: for he shall not enter into the land, which I have given unto the children of Israel, because ye disobeyed my commandment at the water of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up into the mount Hor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cause Aaron to put off his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son: for Aaron shall be gathered to his fathers, and shall die there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses did as the Lord had commanded: and they went up into the mount Hor, in the sight of all the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses put off Aaronâ€™s clothes, and put them upon Eleazar his son: so Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from off the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the Congregation saw that Aaron was dead, all the house of Israel wept for Aaron thirty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt toward the South, heard tell that Israel came by the way of the spies, then fought he against Israel, and took of them prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel vowed a vow unto the Lord, and said, If thou wilt deliver and give this people into mine hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord heard the voice of Israel, and delivered them the Canaanites: and they utterly destroyed them and their cities, and called the name of the place Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they departed from the mount Hor by the way of the Red Sea, to compass the land of Edom: and the people were sore grieved because of the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people spake against God, and against Moses, saying, Wherefore have ye brought us out of Egypt, to die in the wilderness, for here is neither bread nor water, and our soul loatheth this light bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the Lord sent fiery serpents among the people, which stung the people: so that many of the people of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the people came to Moses, and said, We have sinned: for we have spoken against the Lord, and against thee: pray to the Lord, that he take away the serpents from us: and Moses prayed for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Make thee a fiery serpent, and set it up for a sign, that as many as are bitten, may look upon it, and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses made a serpent of brass, and set it up for a sign: and when a serpent had bitten a man, then he looked to the serpent of brass, and lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel departed thence, and pitched in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Oboth, and pitched in Ije Abarim, in the wilderness, which is before Moab on the East side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They removed thence, and pitched upon the river of Zared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thence they departed, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wilderness, and cometh out of the coasts of the Amorites: (for Arnon is the border of Moab, between the Moabites and the Amorites),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore it shall be spoken in the book of the battles of the Lord, what thing he did in the red sea, and in the rivers of Arnon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the stream of the rivers that goeth down to the dwelling of Ar, and lieth upon the border of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from thence they turned to Beer: the same is the well where the Lord said unto Moses, Assemble the people, and I will give them water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel sang this song, Rise up well, sing ye unto it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes dug this well, the captains of the people dug it, even the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderness they came to Mattanah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Bamoth in the valley, that is in the plain of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel sent messengers unto Sihon, king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me go through thy land: we will not turn aside into the fields, nor into the vineyards, neither drink of the waters of the wells: we will go by the kingâ€™s way, until we be past thy country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon gave Israel no license to pass through his country, but Sihon assembled all his people, and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and he came to Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Israel smote him with the edge of the sword, and conquered his land, from Arnon unto Jabbok, even unto the children of Ammon, for the border of the children of Ammon was strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel took all these cities, and dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites in Heshbon, and in all the villages thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, which had fought beforetime against the king of the Moabites, and had taken all his land out of his hand, even unto Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore they that speak in proverbs, say, Come to Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and repaired,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a fire is gone out of Heshbon, and a flame from the city of Sihon, and hath consumed Ar of the Moabites, and the lords of Bamoth in Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to thee, Moab: O people of Chemosh, thou art undone: he hath suffered his sons to be pursued, and his daughters to be in captivity to Sihon the king of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their empire also is lost from Heshbon unto Dibon, and we have destroyed them unto Nophah, which reacheth unto Medeba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent to search out Jazer, and they took the towns belonging thereto, and rooted out the Amorites that were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they turned, and went up toward Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against them, he, and all his people, to fight at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Fear him not: for I have delivered him into thine hand, and all his people, and his land: and thou shalt do to him as thou diddest unto Sihon the king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They smote him therefore, and his sons, and all his people, until there was none left him: so they conquered his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, the children of Israel departed and pitched in the plain of Moab on the other side of Jordan from Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Moabites were sore afraid of the people, because they were many, and Moab fretted against the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Moab said unto the Elders of Midian, Now shall this multitude lick up all that are round about us, as an ox licketh up the grass of the field: and Balak the son of Zippor was King of the Moabites at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent messengers therefore unto Balaam the son of Beor to Pethor (which is by the river of the land of the children of his folk) to call him, saying, Behold, there is a people come out of Egypt, which cover the face of the earth, and lie over against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come now therefore, I pray thee, and curse me this people (for they are stronger than I) so it may be that I shall be able to smite them, and to drive them out of the land: for I know that he, whom thou blessest, is blessed, and he whom thou cursest, shall be cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Elders of Moab, and the Elders of Midian departed, having the reward of the soothsaying in their hand, and they came unto Balaam, and told him the words of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who answered them, Tarry here this night, and I will give you an answer, as the Lord shall say unto me. So the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God came unto Balaam, and said, What men are these with thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Baalam said unto God, Balak the son of Zippor king of Moab hath sent unto me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there is a people come out of Egypt, and covereth the face of the earth: come now, curse them for my sake: so it may be that I shall be able to overcome them in battle, and to drive them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said unto Balaam, Go not thou with them, neither curse the people, for they are blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princes of Balak, Return unto your land: for the Lord hath refused to give me leave to go with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the princes of Moab rose up, and went unto Balak, and said, Balaam hath refused to come with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak yet sent again more princes, and more honorable than they,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who came to Balaam, and said to him, Thus saith Balak the son of Zippor, Be not thou stayed, I pray thee, from coming unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will promote thee unto great honor, and will do whatsoever thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam answered, and said unto the servants of Balak, If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the Lord my God, to do less or more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, I pray you, tarry here this night, that I may wit, what the Lord will say unto me more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came unto Balaam by night, and said unto him, If the men come to call thee, rise up, and go with them: but only what thing I say unto thee, that shalt thou do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam rose up early, and saddled his ass, and went with the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the wrath of God was kindled, because he went: and the Angel of the Lord stood in the way to be against him, as he rode upon his ass, and his two servants were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ass saw the Angel of the Lord stand in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand, the ass turned out of the way, and went into the field, but Balaam smote the ass to turn her into the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Angel of the Lord stood in a path of the vineyards, having a wall on the one side, and a wall on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ass saw the Angel of the Lord, she thrust herself unto the wall, and dashed Balaamâ€™s foot against the wall: wherefore he smote her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord went further, and stood in a narrow place, where was no way to turn, either to the right hand, or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ass saw the Angel of the Lord, she lay down under Balaam: therefore Balaam was very wroth, and smote the ass with a staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me now three times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto the ass, Because thou hast mocked me: I would there were a sword in mine hand, for now would I kill thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ass said unto Balaam, Am not I thine ass, which thou hast ridden upon since thy first time unto this day? have I used at any time, to do thus unto thee? Who said, Nay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the Angel of the Lord standing in the way with his sword drawn in his hand: then he bowed himself, and fell flat on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel of the Lord said unto him, Wherefore hast thou now smitten thine ass three times? behold, I came out to withstand thee, because thy way is not straight before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ass saw me, and turned from me now three times: for else, if she had not turned from me, surely I had even now slain thee, and saved her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said unto the Angel of the Lord, I have sinned: for I wist not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore if it displease thee, I will turn home again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Angel said unto Balaam, Go with the men: but what I say unto thee, that shalt thou speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Balak heard that Balaam came, he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab, which is in the border of Arnon, even in the utmost coast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said unto Balaam, Did not I send for thee to call thee? Wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee unto honor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam made answer unto Balak, Lo, I am come unto thee, and can I now say anything at all? the word that God putteth in my mouth that shall I speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam went with Balak, and they came unto the city of Huzoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak offered bullocks, and sheep, and sent thereof to Balaam, and to the princes that were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow Balak took Balaam and brought him up into the high places of Baal, that thence he might see the utmost part of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks, and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam said, and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go, if so be that the Lord will come and meet me: and whatsoever he showeth me, I will tell thee: so he went forth alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God met Balaam, and Balaam said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and have offered upon every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord put an answer in Balaamâ€™s mouth, and said, Go again to Balak, and say on this wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he turned unto him, lo, he stood by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he uttered his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram out of the mountains of the East, saying, Come, curse Jacob for my sake: come, and detest Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How shall I curse, where God hath not cursed? or how shall I detest, where the Lord hath not detested?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from the top of the rocks I did see him, and from the hills I did behold him: lo, the people shall dwell by themselves, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can tell the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said, Must I not take heed to speak that, which the Lord hath put in my mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, whence thou mayest see them, and thou shalt see but the utmost part of them and shalt not see them all: therefore curse them out of that place for my sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought him into Zophim to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, and I will meet the Lord yonder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord met Balaam, and put an answer in his mouth, and said, Go again unto Balak, and say thus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him: so Balak said unto him, What hath the Lord said?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he uttered his parable, and said, Rise up Balak, and hear: hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is not as man, that he should lie, neither as the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? and hath he spoken, and shall he not accomplish it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have received commandment to bless: for he hath blessed, and I cannot alter it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He seeth none iniquity in Jacob, nor seeth no transgression in Israel: the Lord his God is with him, and the joyful shout of a King is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God brought them out of Egypt: their strength is as an unicorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is no sorcery in Jacob, nor soothsaying in Israel, according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the people shall rise up as a lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down, till he eat of the prey, and till he drink the blood of the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse, nor bless them at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam answered, and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the Lord speaketh, that must I do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place, if so be it will please God, that thou mayest thence curse them for my sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said unto Balak, Make me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks, and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, then he went not, as certain times before, to set divinations, but set his face toward the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam lift up his eyes, and looked upon Israel, which dwelt according to their tribes, and the Spirit of God came upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he uttered his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes were shut up, hath said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath said which heard the words of God, and saw the vision of the Almighty, and falling in a trance had his eyes opened:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How goodly are thy tents, O Jacob, and thine habitations, O Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the valleys are they stretched forth, as gardens by the riverâ€™s side, as the aloe trees, which the Lord hath planted, as the cedars beside the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The water droppeth out of his bucket, and his seed shall be in many waters, and his King shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God brought him out of Egypt: his strength shall be as an unicorn: he shall eat the nations his enemies, and bruise their bones, and shoot them through with his arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He coucheth, and lieth down as a young Lion, and as a Lion: Who shall stir him up? blessed is he that blesseth thee, and cursed is he that curseth thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak was very angry with Balaam, and smote his hands together: so Balak said unto Balaam, I sent for thee to curse mine enemies, and behold, thou hast blessed them now three times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now flee unto thy place: I thought surely to promote thee unto honor, but lo, the Lord hath kept thee back from honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam answered Balak, Told I not also thy messengers, which thou sentest unto me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot pass the commandment of the Lord, to do either good or bad of mine own mind? what the Lord shall command, that same will I speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now behold, I go unto my people: come, I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy folk in the latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he uttered his parable, and said Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes were shut up hath said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath said that heard the words of God, and hath the knowledge of the most High, and saw the vision of the Almighty, and falling in a trance had his eyes opened:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not near: there shall come a Star of Jacob, and a Scepter shall rise of Israel and shall smite the coasts of Moab, and destroy all the sons of Sheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Edom shall be possessed, and Seir shall be a possession to their enemies: but Israel shall do valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also that shall have dominion shall be of Jacob, and shall destroy the remnant of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he looked on Amalek, he uttered his parable, and said, Amalek was the first of the nations: but his latter end shall come to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked on the Kenites, and uttered his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwelling place, and put thy nest in the rock:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the Kenite shall be spoiled, until Asshur carry thee away captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he uttered his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God doeth this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ships also shall come from the coasts of Kittim, and subdue Asshur, and shall subdue Eber, and he also shall come to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Israel abode in Shittim, the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which called the people unto the sacrifice of their gods, and the people ate, and bowed down to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel coupled himself unto Baal of Peor: wherefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people and hang them up before the Lord against the Sun, that the indignation of the Lordâ€™s wrath may be turned from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said unto the Judges of Israel, Everyone slay his men that were joined unto Baal of Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the Congregation of the children of Israel, who wept before the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Phinehas the son of Eleazar the son of Aaron the Priest saw it, he rose up from the midst of the Congregation, and took a spear in his hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And followed the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust them both through: to wit, the man of Israel, and the woman, through her belly: so the plague ceased from the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there died in that plague four and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the Priest, hath turned mine anger away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them: therefore I have not consumed the children of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore say to him, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of the Priestâ€™s office forever, because he was zealous for his God, and hath made an atonement for the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the Israelite thus slain, which was killed with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, prince of the family of the Simeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain, was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, who was head over the people of his fatherâ€™s house in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Vex the Midianites, and smite them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they trouble you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you as concerning Peor, and as concerning their sister Cozbi daughter of a prince of Midian, which was slain in the day of the plague because of Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so after the plague, the Lord spake unto Moses, and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the Priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the number of all the Congregation of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and above, throughout their fatherâ€™s houses, all that go forth to war in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the Priest spake unto them in the plain of Moab, by Jordan toward Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From twenty years old and above ye shall number the people, as the Lord had commanded Moses, and the children of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben the firstborn of Israel: the children of Reuben were: Hanoch, of whom came the family of the Hanochites, and of Pallu the family of the Palluites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Reubenites: and they were in number three and forty thousand, seven hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Pallu, Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Eliab, Nemuel, and Dathan and Abiram: this Dathan and Abiram were famous in the Congregation, and strove against Moses and against Aaron in the assembly of Korah, when they strove against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up with Korah, when the Congregation died, what time the fire consumed two hundred and fifty men, who were for a sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, all the sons of Korah died not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Simeon after their families were: Nemuel, of whom came the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin the family of the Jachinites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Simeonites: two and twenty thousand, and two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad after their families were: Zephon, of whom came the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Ozni the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Arod, the family of the Arodites: of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Gad, according to their numbers forty thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah, Er and Onan, but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So were the sons of Judah after their families: of Shelah came the family of the Shelanites: of Perez, the family of the Parzites, of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Hamul the family of the Hamulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Judah, after their numbers, seventy and six thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar after their families were: Tola, of whom came the family of the Tolaites: of Puah, the family of the Punites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Jashub the family of the Jashubites: of Shimron the family of the Shimronites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Issachar, after their numbers, threescore and four thousand and three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun, after their families were: of Sered, the family of the Sardites: of Elon, the family of the Elonites: of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Zebulunites, after their numbers threescore thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Joseph after their families were: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh were of Machir, the family of the Machirites: and Machir begat Gilead: of Gilead came the family of the Gileadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Jeezer, the family of the Jeezerites, of Helek, the family of the Helekites.
