verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Asriel the family of the Asrielites: of Shechem, the family of Shechemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites: of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Manasseh, and the number of them, two and fifty thousand and seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah came the family of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the family of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim after their numbers two and forty thousand and five hundred: these are the sons of Joseph after their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela came the family of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham the family of the Huphamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Bela, were Ard and Naaman; of Ard came the family of the Ardites, of Naaman the family of the Naamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin after their families, and their numbers, five and forty thousand and six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dan after their families: of Shuham came the family of the Shuhamites: these are the families of Dan after their households.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the families of the Shuhamites were after their numbers, threescore and four thousand, and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher after their families were of Jimna, the families of the Jimnites: of Jesui, the family of the Jesuites: of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Beriah were: of Heber, the family of the Heberites: of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Asher after their numbers three and fifty thousand and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali, after their families were: of Jahzeel, the families of the Jahzeelites: of Guni, the family of the Gunites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites: of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Naphtali according to their households, and their number, five and forty thousand and four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbers of the children of Israel: six hundred and one thousand seven hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance, according to the number of names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To many thou shalt give the more inheritance, and to few thou shalt give less inheritance: to every one according to his number shall be given his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, the land shall be divided by lot: according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the lot shall the possession thereof be divided between many and few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also are the numbers of the Levites, after their families: of Gershon came the family of the Gershonites: of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites: of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Levi, the family of the Libnites: the family of the Hebronites: the family of the Mahlites: the family of the Mushites: the family of the Korathites: and Kohath begat Amram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amramâ€™s wife was called Jochebed the daughter of Levi, which was born unto Levi in Egypt: and she bare unto Amram Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto Aaron were born Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nadab and Abihu died, because they offered strange fire before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their numbers were three and twenty thousand, all males from a month old and above, for they were not numbered among the children of Israel, because there was none inheritance given them among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbers of Moses and Eleazar the Priest which numbered the children of Israel in the plain of Moab, near Jordan, toward Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And among these there was not a man of them, whom Moses and Aaron the Priest numbered, when they told the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord said unto them, They shall die in the wilderness: so there was not left a man of them, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the family of Manasseh, the son of Joseph (and the names of his daughters were these, Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the Priest, and before the Princes, and all the assembly at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not among the assembly of them that were assembled against the Lord in the company of Korah, but died in his sin, and had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore should the name of our father be taken away from among his family, because he hath no son? give us a possession among the brethren of our father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought their cause before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt give them a possession to inherit among their fatherâ€™s brethren, and shalt turn the inheritance of their father unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die and have no son, then ye shall turn his inheritance unto his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he have no daughter, ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he have no brethren, ye shall give his inheritance unto his fatherâ€™s brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if his father have no brethren, ye shall give his inheritance unto his next kinsman of his family, and he shall possess it: and this shall be unto the children of Israel a law of judgment, as the Lord hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord said unto Moses, Go up into this mount of Abarim, and behold the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thou hast seen it, thou shalt be gathered unto thy people also, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye were disobedient unto my word in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the assembly to sanctify me in the waters before their eyes: That is the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spake unto the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Lord God of the spirits of all flesh appoint a man over the Congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who may go out and in before them, and lead them out and in, that the Congregation of the Lord be not as sheep, which have not a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, in whom is the Spirit, and put thine hands upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And set him before Eleazar the Priest, and before all the Congregation, and give him a charge in their sight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And give him of thy glory, that all the Congregation of the children of Israel may obey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall stand before Eleazar the Priest, who shall ask counsel for him by the judgment of Urim before the Lord: at his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him, and all the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did as the Lord hath commanded him, and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the Priest, and before all the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the Lord had spoken by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shall observe to offer unto me in their due season mine offering, and my bread for my sacrifices made by fire for a sweet savor unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also thou shalt say unto them, This is the offering made by fire which ye shall offer unto the Lord, two lambs of a year old, without spot daily, for a continual burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One lamb shalt thou prepare in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou prepare at even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tenth part of an Ephah of fine flour for a meat offering mingled with the fourth part of an Hin of beaten oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be a daily burnt offering, as was made in the mount Sinai for a sweet savor: it is a sacrifice made by fire unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the drink offering thereof the fourth part of an Hin for one lamb: in the holy place cause to pour the drink offering unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other lamb thou shalt prepare at even: as the meat offering of the morning, and as the drink offering thereof shalt thou prepare this for an offering made by fire of sweet savor unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the Sabbath day ye shall offer two lambs of a year old, without spot, and two tenth deals of fine flour for a meat offering mingled with oil, and the drink offering thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, beside the continual burnt offering, and drink offering thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the beginning of your months, ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the Lord, two young bullocks, and a ram, and seven lambs of a year old, without spot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And three tenth deals of fine flour for a meat offering mingled with oil for one bullock, and two tenth deals of fine flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil for one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a tenth deal of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering unto one lamb, for a burnt offering of sweet savor: it is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their drink offerings shall be half an Hin of wine unto one bullock, and the third part of an Hin unto a ram, and the fourth part of an Hin unto a lamb: this is the burnt offering of every month, throughout the months of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one he goat for a sin offering unto the Lord shall be prepared, besides the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the fourteenth day of the first month is the Passover of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first day shall be an holy convocation, ye shall do no servile work therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall offer a sacrifice made by fire for a burnt offering unto the Lord, two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs of a year old: see that they be without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering shall be of fine flour mingled with oil: three tenth deals shall ye prepare for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One tenth deal shalt thou prepare for every lamb, even for the seven lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall prepare these beside the burnt offering in the morning, which is a continual burnt sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this manner ye shall prepare throughout all the seven days, for the maintaining of the offering made by fire for a sweet savor unto the Lord: it shall be done beside the continual burnt offering and drink offering thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the seventh day ye shall have an holy convocation, wherein ye shall do no servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also in the day of your firstfruits, when ye bring a new meat offering unto the Lord, according to your weeks ye shall have an holy convocation: and ye shall do no servile work in it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall offer a burnt offering for a sweet savor unto the Lord, two young bullocks, a ram, and seven lambs of a year old,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering of fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto a bullock, two tenth deals to a ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one tenth deal unto every lamb throughout the seven lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat to make an atonement for you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Ye shall do this besides the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering:) see they be without blemish, with their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, in the first day of the seventh month ye shall have an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work therein: it shall be a day of blowing the trumpets unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall make a burnt offering for a sweet savor unto the Lord: one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of a year old, without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering shall be of fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto the bullock, and two tenth deals unto the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one tenth deal unto the lamb, for the seven lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering to make an atonement for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beside the burnt offering of the month, and his meat offering, and the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering and the drink offerings of the same according to their manner, for a sweet savor: it is a sacrifice made by fire unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall have in the tenth day of the seventh month, an holy convocation: and ye shall humble yourselves, and shall not do any work therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the Lord for a sweet savor: one young bullock, a ram, and seven lambs of a year old: see they be without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering shall be of fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals to a bullock, and two tenth deals to a ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One tenth deal unto every lamb, throughout the seven lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he goat for a sin offering, (beside the sin offering to make the atonement, and the continual burnt offering and the meat offering thereof) and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, ye shall have an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work therein, but ye shall keep a feast unto the Lord seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall offer a burnt offering for a sacrifice made by fire of sweet savor unto the Lord, thirteen young bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of a year old: they shall be without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering shall be of fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto every bullock of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth deals to either of the two rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one tenth deal unto each of the fourteen lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second day ye shall offer twelve young bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams and for the lambs according to their number, after the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, (beside the continual burnt offering and his meat offering) and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the third day ye shall offer eleven bullocks, two rams and fourteen lambs of a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With their meat offering and their drink offerings, for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, after their number, according to the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fourth day ye shall offer ten bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of a year old without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their meat offering and their drink offerings, for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs according to their number after the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifth day also ye shall offer nine bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering, and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs according to their number, after the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the sixth day ye shall offer eight bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering, and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs according to their number, after the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering and his drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh day also ye shall offer seven bullocks, two rams and fourteen lambs of a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their meat offering, and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs according to their number, after their manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eighth day, ye shall have a solemn assembly: ye shall do no servile work therein,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire for a sweet savor unto the Lord, one bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullock, for the ram, and for the lambs according to their number, after the manner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an he goat for a sin offering, beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things ye shall do unto the Lord in your feasts, beside your vows, and your free offerings, for your burnt offerings, and for your meat offerings, and for your drink offerings, and for your peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spake unto the children of Israel according to all that the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses also spake unto the heads of the tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the Lord hath commanded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever voweth a vow unto the Lord, or sweareth an oath to bind himself by a bond, he shall not break his promise, but shall do according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman also vow a vow unto the Lord, and bind herself by a bond, being in her fatherâ€™s house, in the time of her youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her father hear her vow and bond, wherewith she hath bound herself, and her father hold his peace concerning her, then all her vows shall stand and every bond, wherewith she hath bound herself, shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her father disallow her the same day that he heareth all her vows and bonds, wherewith she hath bound herself, they shall not be of value, and the Lord will forgive her, because her father disallowed her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if she have an husband when she voweth or pronounceth ought with her lips, wherewith she bindeth herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her husband heard it, and holdeth his peace concerning her, the same day he heareth it, then her vow shall stand, and her bonds wherewith she bindeth herself shall stand in effect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband disallow her the same day that he heareth it, then shall he make her vow which she hath made, and that that she hath pronounced with her lips, wherewith she bound herself, of none effect: and the Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every vow of a widow, and of her that is divorced (wherewith she hath bound herself) shall stand in effect with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if she vowed in her husbandâ€™s house, or bound herself straightly with an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her husband hath heard it, and held his peace concerning her, not disallowing her, then all her vows shall stand, and every bond, wherewith she bound herself, shall stand in effect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband disannulled them the same day that he heard them, nothing that proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows or concerning her bonds, shall stand in effect: for her husband hath disannulled them: and the Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So every vow, and every oath or bond, made to humble the soul, her husband may stablish it, or her husband may break it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband hold his peace concerning her from day to day, then he stablisheth all her vows and all her bonds which she hath made: he hath confirmed them because he held his peace concerning her the same day that he heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he break them after that he hath heard them, then shall he bear her iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ordinances which the Lord commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, and between the father and his daughter, being young in her fatherâ€™s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Revenge the children of Israel of the Midianites, and afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spake to the people, saying, Harness some of you unto war, and let them go against Midian, to execute the vengeance of the Lord against Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A thousand of every tribe throughout all the tribes of Israel shall ye send to the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there were taken out of the thousands of Israel, twelve thousand prepared unto war, of every tribe a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent them to the war, even a thousand of every tribe, and sent them with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the Priest to the war: and the holy instruments, that is, the trumpets to blow were in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they warred against Midian, as the Lord had commanded Moses, and slew all the males.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They slew also the kings of Midian among them that were slain: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian, and they slew Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children of Israel took the women of Midian prisoners, and their children, and spoiled all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they burnt all their cities, wherein they dwelt, and all their villages with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took all the spoil, and all the prey both of men and beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the captives and that which they had taken, and the spoil unto Moses and to Eleazar the Priest, and unto the Congregation of the children of Israel, into the camp in the plain of Moab, which was by Jordan toward Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Eleazar the Priest, and all the princes of the Congregation went out of the camp to meet them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was angry with the captains of the host, with the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the war and battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto them, What? have ye saved all the women?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these caused the children of Israel through the counsel of Balaam to commit a trespass against the Lord, as concerning Peor, and there came a plague among the Congregation of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, slay all the males among the children, and kill all the women that have known man by carnal copulation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the women-children that have not known carnal copulation, keep alive for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall remain without the host seven days, all that have killed any person, and all that have touched any dead, and purify both yourselves and your prisoners the third day and the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also ye shall purify every garment and all that is made of skins, and all work of goatsâ€™ hair, and all things made of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar the Priest said unto the men of war, which went to the battle, This is the ordinance of the law which the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for gold, and silver, brass, iron, tin, and lead:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even all that may abide the fire, ye shall make it go through the fire, and it shall be clean: yet, it shall be purified with the water of purification: and all that suffereth not the fire, ye shall cause to pass by the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall wash also your clothes the seventh day, and ye shall be clean: and afterward ye shall come into the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the sum of the prey that was taken, both of persons and of cattle, thou and Eleazar the Priest, and the chief fathers of the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And divide the prey between the soldiers that went to the war, and all the Congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take a tribute unto the Lord of the men of war, which went out to battle: one person of five hundred, both of the persons, and of the beeves, and of the asses, and of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall take it of their half, and give it unto Eleazar the Priest, as an heave offering of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of the half of the children of Israel thou shalt take one, taken out of fifty, both of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of the sheep, even of all the cattle, and thou shalt give them unto the Levites, which have the charge of the Tabernacle of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the Priest did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the booty, to wit, the rest of the prey which the men of war had spoiled, was six hundred seventy and five thousand sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seventy and two thousand beeves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And threescore and one thousand asses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two and thirty thousand persons in all, of women that had lain by no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the half, to wit, the part of them that went out to war, touching the number of sheep, was three hundred seven and thirty thousand, and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lordâ€™s tribute of the sheep was six hundred seventy and five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the beeves were six and thirty thousand, whereof the Lordâ€™s tribute was seventy and two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the asses were thirty thousand and five hundred, whereof the Lordâ€™s tribute was threescore and one:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of persons sixteen thousand, whereof the Lordâ€™s tribute was two and thirty persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the tribute of the Lordâ€™s offering unto Eleazar the Priest, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the half of the children of Israel, which Moses divided from the men of war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the half that pertained unto the congregation, was three hundred thirty and seven thousand sheep and five hundred,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And six and thirty thousand beeves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thirty thousand asses, and five hundred,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sixteen thousand persons.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, I say, took of the half that pertained unto the children of Israel, one taken out of fifty, both of the persons, and of the cattle, and gave them unto the Levites, which have the charge of the Tabernacle of the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captains which were over thousands of the host, the captains over the thousands, and the captains over the hundreds came unto Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said to Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our authority, and there lacketh not one man of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have therefore brought a present unto the Lord, what every man found of Jewels of gold, bracelets, and chains, rings, earrings, and ornaments of the legs, to make an atonement for our souls before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the Priest took the gold of them, and all wrought jewels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the gold of the offering that they offered up to the Lord (of the captains over thousands and hundreds) was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the men of war had spoiled, every man for himself.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the Priest took the gold of the captains over the thousands, and over the hundreds, and brought it into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, for a memorial of the children of Israel before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad had an exceeding great multitude of cattle: and they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that it was an apt place for cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Gad, and the children of Reuben came, and spake unto Moses and to Eleazar the Priest, and unto the Princes of the Congregation, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Shebam, and Nebo, and Beon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which country the Lord smote before the Congregation of Israel; is a land meet for cattle, and thy servants have cattle:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, said they, if we have found grace in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy servants for a possession, and bring us not over Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, Shall your brethren go to war, and ye tarry here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore now discourage you the heart of the children of Israel to go over into the land, which the Lord hath given them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did your fathers, when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they went up even unto the river of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they would not go into the land, which the Lord had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lordâ€™s wrath was kindled the same day, and he did swear, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the men that came out of Egypt, from twenty years old and above, shall see the land for the which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, because they have not wholly followed me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun: for they have constantly followed the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord was very angry with Israel, and made [them] wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation that had done evil in the sight of the Lord, was consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, ye are risen up in your fatherâ€™s stead as an increase of sinful men still to augment the fierce wrath of the Lord toward Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if ye turn away from following him, he will yet again leave the people in the wilderness, and ye shall destroy all this folk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went near to him, and said, We will build sheepfolds here for our sheep, and for our cattle, and cities for our children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel, until we have brought them unto their place: but our children shall dwell in the defensed cities, because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not return unto our houses, until the children of Israel have inherited, every man his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither will we inherit with them beyond Jordan and on that side, because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side Jordan Eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto them, If ye will do this thing, and go armed before the Lord to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And will go every one of you in harness over Jordan before the Lord, until he have cast out his enemies from his sight:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And until the land be subdued before the Lord, then ye shall return and be innocent toward the Lord, and toward Israel: and this land shall be your possession before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sinned against the Lord, and be sure, that your sin will find you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build you then cities for your children, and folds for your sheep, and do that ye have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spake unto Moses, saying, Thy servants will do as my lord commandeth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our children, our wives, our sheep, and all our cattle shall remain there in the cities of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thy servants will go every one armed to war before the Lord for to fight, as my lord saith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So concerning them, Moses commanded Eleazar the Priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto them, If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will go with you over Jordan, all armed to fight before the Lord, then when the land is subdued before you, ye shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they will not go over with you armed, then they shall have their possessions among you in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Gad, and the children of Reuben answered, saying, As the Lord hath said unto thy servants, so will we do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will go armed before the Lord into the land of Canaan: that the possession of our inheritance may be to us on this side Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave unto them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and to half the tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land with the cities thereof and coasts, even the cities of the country round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Gad built Dibon, and Ataroth, and Aroer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Atroth, Shophan, and Jazer, and Jogbehah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran, defensed cities: also sheepfolds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kirjathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nebo, and Baal Meon, and turned their names, and Shibmah: and gave other names unto the cities which they built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, and took it, and put out the Amorites that dwelt therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses gave Gilead unto Machir the son of Manasseh, and he dwelt therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jair the son of Manasseh went and took the small towns thereof, and called them Havoth Jair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Nobah went and took Kenath, with the villages thereof, and called it Nobah after his own name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the journeys of the children of Israel, which went out of the land of Egypt, according to their bands under the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses wrote their going out by their journeys, according to the commandment of the Lord: so these are the journeys of their going out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they departed from Rameses the first month, even the fifteenth day of the first month, on the morrow after the Passover: and the children of Israel went out with an high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the Lord had smitten among them: upon their gods also the Lord did execution.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel removed from Rameses, and pitched in Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Succoth, and pitched in Etham, which is in the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Etham, and turned again unto Pi Hahiroth, which is before Baal Zephon, and pitched before Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from before Hahiroth, and went through the midst of the Sea into the wilderness, and went three daysâ€™ journey in the wilderness of Etham, and pitched in Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Marah, and came unto Elim, and in Elim were twelve fountains of water, and seventy palm trees, and they pitched there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Elim, and camped by the red sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from the red Sea, and lay in the wilderness of Sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took their journey out of the wilderness of Sin, and set up their tents in Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Dophkah, and lay in Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Alush, and lay in Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rephidim, and pitched in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from the desert of Sinai, and pitched in Kibroth Hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Kibroth Hattaavah, and lay at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Hazeroth, and pitched in Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rithmah, and pitched at Rimmon Perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rimmon Perez, and pitched in Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Libnah, and pitched in Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journeyed from Rissah, and pitched in Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from Kehelathah, and pitched in mount Shepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from mount Shepher, and lay in Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Haradah, and pitched in Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Makheloth, and lay in Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Tahath, and pitched in Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Terah, and pitched in Mithkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from Mithkah, and pitched in Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Hashmonah, and lay in Moseroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Moseroth, and pitched in Bene Jaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Bene Jaakan, and lay in Hor Hagidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from Hor Hagidgad, and pitched in Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Jotbathah, and lay in Abronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Abronah, and lay in Ezion Geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Ezion Geber, and pitched in the wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Kadesh, and pitched in mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And Aaron the Priest went up into mount Hor, at the commandment of the Lord and died there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the first day of the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron was an hundred and three and twenty years old, when he died in mount Hor.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the South of the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from mount Hor, and pitched in Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Zalmonah, and pitched in Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Punon, and pitched in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Oboth, and pitched in Ije Abarim, in the borders of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Ijim, and pitched in Dibon Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Dibon Gad, and lay in Almon Diblathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Almon Diblathaim, and pitched in the mountains of Abarim before Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from the mountains of Abarim, and pitched in the plain of Moab by Jordan toward Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they pitched by Jordan, from Beth Jesimoth unto Abel Shittim, in the plain of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses in the plain of Moab, by Jordan toward Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye are come over Jordan to enter into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall then drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you, and destroy all their pictures, and break asunder all their images of metal, and pluck down all their high places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall possess the land and dwell therein: for I have given you the land to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall inherit the land by lot, according to your families: to the more ye shall give more inheritance, and to the fewer the less inheritance. Where the lot shall fall to any man, that shall be his: according to the tribes of your fathers shall ye inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye will not drive out the inhabitants of the land before you, then those which ye let remain of them, shall be pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides, and shall vex you in the land wherein ye dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, it shall come to pass, that I shall do unto you, as I thought to do unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall unto your inheritance: that is, the land of Canaan with the coasts thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your South quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin to the borders of Edom: so that your South quarter shall be from the salt Sea coast Eastward
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border shall compass you from the South to Maaleh Akrabbim, and reach to Zin, and go out from the South to Kadesh Barnea: thence it shall stretch to Hazar Addar, and go along to Azmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border shall compass from Azmon unto the river of Egypt, and shall go out to the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your West quarter shall be the great sea: even that border shall be your West coast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be your North quarter, ye shall mark out your border from the great sea unto mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From mount Hor ye shall point out till it come unto Hamath, and the end of the coast shall be at Zedad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the coast shall reach out to Ziphron, and go out at Hazar Enan, this shall be your North quarter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall mark out your East quarter from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the coast shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, and from the East side of Ain: and the same border shall descend and go out at the side of the sea of Chinnereth Eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also that border shall go down to Jordan, and leave at the salt sea: this shall be your land with the coasts thereof round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, This is the land which ye shall inherit by lot, which the Lord commanded to give unto nine tribes, and half the tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of the children of Reuben, according to the households of their fathers, and the tribe of the children of Gad, according to their fathersâ€™ households, and half the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two tribes and an half tribe have received their inheritance on this side of Jordan toward Jericho full East.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spake to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men which shall divide the land unto you: Eleazar the Priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall take also a prince of every tribe to divide the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The names also of the men are these: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also of the tribe of the sons of Dan, the prince Bukki, the son of Jogli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Joseph: of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh, the prince Hanniel the son of Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim, the prince Kemuel, the son of Shiphtan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe also of the sons of Zebulun, the prince Elizaphan, the son of Parnach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So of the tribe of the sons of Issachar, the prince Paltiel, the son of Azzan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe also of the sons of Asher, the prince Ahihud, the son of Shelomi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, the prince Pedahel, the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are they, whom the Lord commanded to divide the inheritance unto the children of Israel, in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses in the plain of Moab by Jordan, toward Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the children of Israel, that they give unto the Levites of the inheritance of their possession, cities to dwell in: ye shall give also unto the Levites the suburbs of the cities round about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall have the cities to dwell in, and their suburbs shall be for their cattle, and for their substance, and for all their beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the suburbs of the cities, which ye shall give unto the Levites, from the wall of the city outward shall be a thousand cubits round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall measure without the city of the East side, two thousand cubits: and of the South side, two thousand cubits: and of the West side, two thousand cubits: and of the North side, two thousand cubits: and the city shall be in the midst: this shall be the measure of the suburbs of their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites, there shall be six cities for refuge, which ye shall appoint, that he which killeth, may flee thither: and to them ye shall add two and forty cities more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities which ye shall give to the Levites, shall be eight and forty cities: them shall ye give with their suburbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And concerning the cities which ye shall give, of the possession of the children of Israel: of many ye shall take more, and of few ye shall take less: everyone shall give of his cities unto the Levites, according to his inheritance, which he inheriteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come over Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall appoint you cities, to be cities of refuge for you, that the slayer, which slayeth any person unawares, may flee thither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these cities shall be for you a refuge from thy avenger, that he which killeth, die not, until he stand before the Congregation in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the cities which ye shall give, six cities shall ye have for refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall appoint three on this side Jordan, and ye shall appoint three cities in the land of Canaan which shall be cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These six cities shall be a refuge for the children of Israel, and for the stranger, and for him that dwelleth among you, that everyone which killeth any person unawares, may flee thither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if one smite another with an instrument of iron that he die, he is a murderer, and the murderer shall die the death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also if he smite him by casting a stone, wherewith he may be slain, and he die, he is a murderer, and the murderer shall die the death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may be slain, if he die, he is a murderer, and the murderer shall die the death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The revenger of the blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he thrust him of hate, or hurl at him by laying of wait, that he die,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or smite him through enmity with his hand, that he die, he that smote him shall die the death: for he is a murderer: the revenger of the blood shall slay the murderer when he meeteth him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he pushed him unadvisedly, and not of hatred, or cast upon him anything, without laying of wait,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or any stone (whereby he might be slain), and saw him not, or caused it to fall upon him, and he die, and was not his enemy, neither sought him any harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Congregation shall judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood according to these laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Congregation shall deliver the slayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the Congregation shall restore him unto the city of his refuge, whither he was fled: and he shall abide there unto the death of the high Priest, which is anointed with the holy oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the slayer come without the borders of the city of his refuge, whither he was fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the revenger of blood find him without the borders of the city of his refuge, and the revenger of blood slay the murderer, he shall be guiltless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he should have remained in the city of his refuge, until the death of the high Priest: and after the death of the high Priest, the slayer shall return unto the land of his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these things shall be a law of judgment unto you, throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever killeth any person, the Judge shall slay the murderer, through witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against a person to cause him to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover ye shall take no recompense for the life of the murderer, which is worthy to die: but he shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also ye shall take no recompense for him that is fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come again, and dwell in the land, before the death of the high Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ye shall not pollute the land wherein ye shall dwell: for blood defileth the land: and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Defile not therefore the land which ye shall inhabit, for I dwell in the midst thereof: For I the Lord dwell among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief fathers of the family of the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came, and spake before Moses, and before the princes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, The Lord commanded my lord to give the land to inherit by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commanded by the Lord, to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother unto his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they be married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and shall be put unto the inheritance of the tribe whereof they shall be: so shall it be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also when the Jubilee of the children of Israel cometh, then shall their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the tribe whereof they shall be: so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses commanded the children of Israel, according to the word of the Lord, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph have said well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the thing that the Lord hath commanded, concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, They shall be wives, to whom they think best, only to the family of the tribe of their father shall they marry:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall not the inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe, for every one of the children of Israel shall join himself to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every daughter that possesseth any inheritance of the tribes of the children of Israel, shall be wife unto one of the family of the tribe of her father: that the children of Israel may enjoy every man the inheritance of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither shall the inheritance go about from tribe to tribe: but every one of the tribes of the children of Israel shall stick to his own inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah the daughters of Zelophehad were married unto their fatherâ€™s brotherâ€™s sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were wives to certain of the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph: so their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments and laws which the Lord commanded by the hand of Moses, unto the children of Israel in the plain of Moab, by Jordan toward Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
